property.name: objectDescription
property.value:
Information about a Check. A Check can be one of a:
1. Hold Check: the Issue Id is not null 2. Deadline Check: the Milestone Type Key and Atp Type Key are not null 3. Not Before Check: the Milestone Type Key and Atp Type Key are not null 4. In Time Period Check: the Milestone Type Key and Atp Type Key are not null 5. Outside Date Range Check: the Milestone Type Key and Atp Type Key are not null 6. Statement Check: the Statement Id is not null 7. Process Check: the Process key is not null

property.name: summary
property.value: A description of the entity.

property.name: description
property.value: A description of the entity.

property.name: objectDescription
property.value: A description of the entity.

property.name: shortLabel
property.value: Hold Issue Id

property.name: summary
property.value: The Hold Issue if this Check to check if the student has an applied hold.

property.name: label
property.value: Hold Issue Id

property.name: description
property.value: The Hold Issue if this Check to check if the student has an applied hold.

property.name: shortLabel
property.value: Milestone Type Key

property.name: summary
property.value: The Milestone Type Key if this Check is for a deadline, "not before," "in time period" or "outside date range" checks.

property.name: label
property.value: Milestone Type Key

property.name: description
property.value: The Milestone Type Key if this Check is for a deadline, "not before," "in time period" or "outside date range" checks.

property.name: shortLabel
property.value: Agenda Id

property.name: summary
property.value: The Agenda Id if this Check is based on evaluating an Agenda.

property.name: label
property.value: Agenda Id

property.name: description
property.value: The Agenda Id if this Check is based on evaluating an Agenda. (do we need a reference for the eval?)

property.name: shortLabel
property.value: Child Process Key

property.name: summary
property.value: The Process Key if this Check is to evaluate a all the instructions already defined in another child process.

property.name: label
property.value: Child Process Key

property.name: description
property.value: The Process Key if this Check is to evaluate a all the instructions already defined in another child process.

property.name: shortLabel
property.value: Right Comparison Value

property.name: summary
property.value: A hard coded value for comparison Check Types of min/max/equals.

property.name: label
property.value: Right Comparison Value

property.name: description
property.value:
A hard coded value for comparison Check Types of min/max/equals. The left comparison value may be determined from the context of the process or from an agenda Id.
For example, this value may indicate a hard-coded credit limit per term for all students. The Check may be that the current load does not exceed this hard coded value.

property.name: shortLabel
property.value: Left Comparison Agenda Id

property.name: summary
property.value: The Left Comparison Agenda Id is for comparison Check Types of min/max/equals for determining the left-hand side of the comparison.

property.name: label
property.value: Left Comparison Agenda Id

property.name: description
property.value:
The Left Comparison Agenda Id is for comparison Check Types of min/max/equals for determining the left-hand side of the comparison.
For example, this rule evaluation may determine the current credit load for a particular student in a Term to compare it with a credit limit as determined by getRightComparisonValue() or an evaluation resulting from getRightComparisonAgendaId().

property.name: shortLabel
property.value: Right Comparison Agenda Id

property.name: summary
property.value: The Right Comparison Agenda Id is for comparison Check Types of min/max/equals for determining the right-hand side of the comparison.

property.name: label
property.value: Right Comparison Agenda Id

property.name: description
property.value:
The Right Comparison Agenda Id is for comparison Check Types of min/max/equals for determining the right-hand side of the comparison.
For example, the result of this rule evaluation may calculate the credit limit for a particular student if it fluctuates by other criteria such as Term or Population.

property.name: summary
property.value: Create and last update info for the structure.

property.name: description
property.value:
Create and last update info for the structure. This is optional and treated as read only since the data is set by the internals of the service during maintenance operations.
Contains audit trail information about the creation and last update of this object Also contains the version ind used for optimistic locking.
Attempts to set or update should result in a ReadOnlyException being thrown.

property.name: objectDescription
property.value:
Create and last update info for the structure. This is optional and treated as read only since the data is set by the internals of the service during maintenance operations.
Contains audit trail information about the creation and last update of this object Also contains the version ind used for optimistic locking.
Attempts to set or update should result in a ReadOnlyException being thrown.
